ygData.subject: RE: I won my dream item!!
ygData.msgSnippet: hmm not fair to just blame the humans ... From: Rokenn Swiftsong [mailto:rokenn@hotmail.com] Sent: Friday, February 25, 2000 3:03 PM To: eqbards@onelist.com
ygData.messageBody:
hmm not fair to just blame the humans

-----Original Message-----
From: Rokenn Swiftsong [mailto:rokenn@...]
Sent: Friday, February 25, 2000 3:03 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] I won my dream item!!


From: "Rokenn Swiftsong" <rokenn@...>

It is sad that some people would go so far to cheat. Humans suck :p


>From: "JasonF" <jasonf@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
>Subject: RE: [eqbards] I won my dream item!!
>Date: Fri, 25 Feb 2000 13:51:24 -0600
>
>This is true, and to my knowledge it's the only way to cheat on a roll. If
>Verant hopped the clue train and made the rolls appear in yellow or red
>there'd be no way to cheat. As it is, emotes and rolls are the same color.
>Duh.
>
>Cheetr creates an emote that produces the following:
>
>Cheetr says 'Blah, blah... I hope I win.'_______
>Cheetr could have rolled any number from 1 to 100
>but this time he made sure it was a 98.
>
>Just make double sure that NO ONE in a roll has "said" anything prior to
>the
>roll itself. If anyone has, reroll, perhaps using the method below:
>
>The leader of the group randoms a number 1 to 100 and then the group rolls
>to that. That way no one can use the emote cheat.
>
>Leader rolls 1 to 100 and gets a 43.
>Everyone else does a /random 1 43 for the winner.
>
>The problem with the 1-6 Alpha method is that if the leader and someone in
>the group are wooking in cahoots, the randomer could make sure his buddy
>won
>the roll for the item that he really wanted.
>
>[47 Bard] Crier (Half Elf) <Seekers of Norrath> ZONE: work
>
> > From: jhenders@...
> >
> >
> > One way I've heard of people cheating is to use the space wrap trick.
> > You could type something. i.e.
> >
> > I never win these things<space><space><lots of spaces until your text
> > wraps to the next line> then
> >
> > Blah has rolled......
>
>
